fields.description:
FishEye and Crucible share tags to create the Ajax sourced directory tree builder. Its in the File tab of the Manage Files area on Crucible, and on the Browse, Changelog, and Chart pages for FishEye.

The Ajax request fires off on both properties and data is returned - you can see it in Firebug, for example.

The tree is populated on Crucible, but not the FishEye pages.

The problem occurs on the local versions of Geoff and my machines: http://localhost:6060/foo/chart/edgylicensing/
Everything seems okay on the released code: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE
fields.summary: Sub Directories Ajax not refreshing

fields.description:

We need to someone set a process so that this value is updated when we update svnkit.
fields.summary: Update the jsvn scripts to point to the new 1.2.1r5011.atlassian.jar version of svnkit

fields.description:
On the main page of a repository in the Contstraint Box, leave Brach to (any), select an Author, and select a Date with the DatePicker (e.g. 2008-10-26T00:00:00) and then click on "Apply". 

This will take significantly longer than on other constraints (for eg 10 minutes to complete, but without date constraints, only a few seconds). 

The slow down appears to be due to a combination of setting a Date constraint and checking directories for empty dirs. If {{--Xdisable-dirtree-empty-checks}} flag is passed to fisheye during startup (see [Command Line Options|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/lYCDBQ]), the query will only take around 10secs to return (as opposed to 10mins). 

The check empty dir with combination of date constraint is inefficient.
fields.summary: Date Constraint query combined with checking empty directories takes forever to return

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 

1) Turn on debugging 
2) Navigate to the directory with large number of files, some which have a number of revisions. 
3) Check your logs for the following message:

{noformat}
2008-11-05 16:29:11,781 DEBUG [btpool0-4] fisheye.perf ViewRepositoryServlet-handleDirRequest - handleDirRequest-page for / in 11562ms then 101344ms for render
{noformat}

So it appears rendering takes a long time. 

However doing thread dumps during the wait reveals that it is spending most of the time reading the index to get the File History:

{noformat}
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:474)
	at com.cenqua.obfuscate.idbk981ne._j.a(InfinityDB_1.0.53:379)
	- locked <0x11498690> (a com.cenqua.obfuscate.idbk981ne._h)
	at com.cenqua.obfuscate.idbk981ne._k981neIDB.a(InfinityDB_1.0.53:2341)
	- locked <0x0a3779e8> (a com.cenqua.obfuscate.idbk981ne._k981neIDB)
	at com.cenqua.obfuscate.idbk981ne._k981neIDB.a(InfinityDB_1.0.53:2421)
	at com.cenqua.obfuscate.idbk981ne._k981neIDB.a(InfinityDB_1.0.53:2356)
	at com.cenqua.obfuscate.idbk981ne._k981neIDB.a(InfinityDB_1.0.53:1922)
	at com.cenqua.obfuscate.idbk981ne._k981neIDB.next(InfinityDB_1.0.53:1873)
	at com.cenqua.obfuscate.idbk981ne._k981neIDB.first(InfinityDB_1.0.53:1853)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.infinitydb.EavEntityCu.exists(EavEntityCu.java:295)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.impl.CommonRevInfoDAO.exists(CommonRevInfoDAO.java:86)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.db.SvnRevInfoDAO.loadRevision(SvnRevInfoDAO.java:459)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnCache.getFileHistory(SvnCache.java:241)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.cache.BaseRevisionCache.getFileHistory(BaseRevisionCache.java:45)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.FisheyeRepositoryExplorer.getFiles(FisheyeRepositoryExplorer.java:175)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.FisheyeRepositoryExplorer.getDeletedFilesCount(FisheyeRepositoryExplorer.java:140)
{noformat}

Thread dump is attached.

Data api spike

fields.description:
At the moment the 'reviews' EyeQL clause only returns reviews that the returned revision(s) are the latest version in.

For the new JIRA FishEye plugin [Code Reviewed workflow condition|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/FISH-202] to work properly the 'reviews' clause should return all reviews that encompass the revision either explicitly or as part of a merged view.

e.g. If review {{CR-1337}} includes the file {{GenericManager.java}} from revision {{20021}} to {{21007}}, the reviews return clause for revision {{GenericManager.java}} @ {{r20987}} should contain {{CR-1337}}.
fields.summary: 'reviews' EyeQL return clause should return all reviews that the revision is included in

fields.description: When authenticating a user against crowd, if that user fails to authenticate due to not being permitted to access the application (that is, their username and password is correct, but they haven't been granted access to the application in Crowd), the Crowd integration client throws an ApplicationAccessDeniedException.  This is then logged at the warning level in FishEye, with a message of "Problem communicating with Crowd".  This should not happen, rather, it should be treated the same as if the username and password were incorrect (which currently logs a message at info saying "user not found").
fields.summary: Extraneous warnings logged when user is denied access to application by Crowd

fields.description:
When indexing large perforce database, fisheye seems to stop indexing when it reaches a large file. When this happens the repository is available, however not all directories are index.

I have also useds an 'exclude' {{**/*.ncb}} to try to get around this, however it does not seem to make a difference.

Log file snippet referenced below.

{code:none}
WARN  - [cobra:1667//E911/Patriot/main] Not indexing contents of HEAD of PCS/com
mon/pcs_applet/pcs_cpl_app/PCSCPLAPP.VS2008.ncb because its size (13757153B) is
too large (limit is 5MB)
INFO  - finished initial scan of repository patriot in 642s
{code}
fields.summary: Fisheye stops indexing when reaching large file

fields.description:
If I have a file named FileA which was created by UserA, and then UserB integrates FileA to FileB and deletes FileA, all lines in FileB will show up as authored by UserB. This flows through to aggregate line counts and everything else.

As UserA:
{noformat}
p4 add FileA
p4 submit
p4 annotate FileA <-- Shows all lines owned by UserA
view FileA in FishEye <-- Shows all lines owned by UserA
{noformat}

As UserB:
{noformat}
p4 integ FileA FileB
p4 delete FileA
p4 submit
p4 annotate FileB <-- Shows all lines still owned by UserA
view FileB in FishEye <-- Shows all lines owned by UserB
{noformat}

Note that the same operation (p4 annotate) in p4 command-line or in p4v does not suffer from this, and detects when individual lines were originally authored by UserA, but UserB just changed the name of the file (or even changed the file name and changed 3 lines: only those 3 lines will show up as authored by UserB, rather than the whole file).
fields.summary: Annotation with Perforce doesn't take into account individual-file branching

fields.description:
I don't know if this applies to other SCM systems, but it definitely applies to Perforce.

In Perforce, there are three operations that you can do which will "change history" (which otherwise can't be done):
1) Obliterating files
2) Changing submitted changelist descriptions
3) Assigning a job to a submitted changelist

All three are pretty common in Perforce (well, #2 less so than the others), and lead to FishEye reporting different results than other tools, because FishEye never rescans things that it's already scanned.

The only current solution to this is to perform a reindex, which for us takes many many hours (our main p4 repository has >145k changelists). Therefore, the only time that we can realistically do it is over a weekend, which means that someone in the latest time zone has to remember to kick it off Friday night just before they leave. That isn't ideal.

We'd much prefer to be able to automatically schedule a weekly reindex so that any changes in terms of obliteration or retrospective changes to perforce history are picked up at least once a week.
fields.summary: Automatically periodically reindex repositories, particularly with Perforce

fields.description:
When the Crucible evaluation license expires, access to Fisheye functionality is locked out. This should gracefully degrade back to the Fisheye production license.

In addition, if you startup fisheye, you will get the setup page. When you only enter the fisheye license, it will take you back to the setup page (like you haven't done anything). 

This is because the config.xml file still contains the crucible license (thus by only entering the fisheye license, the crucible license does not get overridden to empty). 

h4. Workaround. 

1) Shutdown server
2) Remove the <fisheye/> and <crucible/> tags within the <license/> tag in {{FISHEYE_INST/config.xml}} file. I.e. 

from:

{noformat}
<license SID="AG6H-KX6L-9PTU-RXPQ"><fisheye>nNnmnCluMwDDUkWnAdUOtMEHkqnunVbRFNbDsfJNPWStBTL
...
...
...</fisheye><crucible>nNnmnCluMwDDUkWnAdUOtMEHkqnunVbRFNbDsfJNPWStBTL
...
...</cruible></license>
{noformat}

to:

{noformat}
<license SID="AG6H-KX6L-9PTU-RXPQ"></license>
{noformat}

 
3) Restart server. This time when you go to setup screen enter your fisheye license only, you will be able to get into the administration screen.
fields.summary: With a production Fisheye license and an eval Crucible license, expiration of the eval license prevents access to licensed Fisheye functionality.

fields.description:
Currently, if a file has the property set as mime-type= application/octet-stream this file is considered binary. 

However it would be nice to be able to override this. 

For example in one customers case (CRC-372) all their *.js files have the above mime-type but are text files.

If we had an administration option to set all *.js files as text, it would be good.
fields.summary: Add the administration ability to override whether a file is displayed as binary or not

fields.description: Currently when we retrieve LOC data for charts or raw data export we collect all the data, then process it.  This could potentially be a lot of data using a lot of memory unnecessarily, so this should be redesigned to process data as its retrieved.
fields.summary: reduce memory liability of loc data retrieval

fields.description:
The current search results enumeration works well with low numbers of results, but when results number in the thousands the UI gets cluttered and unuseable. Enabling pagination style navigation will clean the UI and make the search results more accessible.

Additionally, we need to change the HTML structure of the results so that CSS and behaviour can be applied.

First step will be finding a suitable number of results to display, and then massaging the larger result set in.
If 9 page options works well:
Displaying results 1 - 50 of 342:  <   1  ,  2  ,  3  ,  4  ,  5  ,  6  ,  7  >
We need a model for larger result sets:
Displaying results 301 - 350 of 5212:  <   1, ... , 5 , 6 , 7 , 8 , 9 , ... , 105  > 

Then we need to improve the data returned, add it to the new structure, and we're away.
fields.summary: Improve pagination for search results

fields.description:
The following information needs to be added in three places to make support a bit easier. 

The three places
a) Administration > Sys-Info Page (sysinfo.jsp) 
b) create support request via Administration page (fisheye-support-request.ftl)
c) In the log file (after startup system information should be outputted in case they don't provide the information)

Things that need to be added 
1) JVM Input Arguments (similar to how JIra do it)
{noformat}
     JIRA Build                          : Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.13-#330
     JIRA Installation Type              : Standalone
     Application Server                  : Apache Tomcat/5.5.26 - Servlet API 2.4
     Java Version                        : 1.6.0_06 - Sun Microsystems Inc.
     Current Working Directory           : /home/atlassian/jira-enterprise/bin
     Maximum Allowable Memory            : 254MB
     Total Memory                        : 127MB
     Free Memory                         : 124MB
     Used Memory                         : 3MB
     Total PermGen Memory                : 160MB
     Free PermGen Memory                 : 150MB
     Used PermGen Memory                 : 9MB
     JVM Input Arguments                 : -XX:MaxPermSize=128m -Xms128m -Xmx256m -Djava.awt.headless=true -Datlassian.standalone=JIRA -Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager -Djava.util.logging.config.file=/home/atlassian/jira-enterprise/conf/logging.properties -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/home/atlassian/jira-enterprise/common/endorsed -Dcatalina.base=/home/atlassian/jira-enterprise -Dcatalina.home=/home/atlassian/jira-enterprise -Djava.io.tmpdir=/home/atlassian/jira-enterprise/temp
{noformat}
2) Java System properties 
3) Installed plugins (similar to how Jira )
{noformat}
     FishEye Plugin                      : com.atlassian.jira.ext.fisheye
          Version                             : 2.1
          Status                              : enabled
          Vendor                              : Atlassian Software Systems
          Description                         : JIRA Fisheye Plugin
....
{noformat}
4) Trusted Apps configuration (i.e. which servers does fisheye/crucible trust)
5) Location of FISHEYE_HOME and FISHEYE_INST (not included in the logs)
6) API is enabled
7) Debug is turned ON or OFF
8) Other Server Settings (such as context, configured URL, resource limits etc).
fields.summary: Improve System information page

See [http://svnbook.red-bean.com/nightly/en/svn.branchmerge.advanced.html#svn.branchmerge.advanced.logblame]

Generated from [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-1183]

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1) In crowd create a nested group where group fish is nested with group atlassian. Define some users that belong to group atlassian. 
2) In fisheye, hook up to crowd and specify only group fish can access your repositories
3) Log in as user defined in 1) and you will not be able to see the repository. 

If you allow group atlassian to view the repository then and only then will the users be able to access the repository.
fields.summary: Permission checks against crowd nested groups does not work in fisheye.

fields.description:
It would be great if customers could test out their includes/excludes against the repository they have added in fisheye. 

For example if they add the \{**/temp/data/\} to the excludes then they should be able to test this against their repo and fisheye should tell them which paths in their repos will be excluded. 

E.g. 
projecta/temp/data/*
prjectb/submodule/temp/data/*
etc

So they can confirm they are excluding/including the right folders before they re-index their repository. 

For some customers a reindex can take days and after having done that, realising they had the wrong syntax for an includes and excludes can mean a very expensive trial and error process.
fields.summary: Add Validation on Excludes/Includes

Introduce validation to ensure that users are entering the correct figure.
fields.summary: Introduce validation for Updater in fisheye or make configuration foolproof

fields.description:
To reproduce 

In 1.6.1 go to Admin > Server Settings > Edit and your originally blank context will have some value such as "ognl.OgnlContext@649af4c6". 

The workaround for customers if they get the following error on their screen:

{noformat}
No context on this server matched or handled his request 
Contexts known to this server are:
* /ognl.OgnlContext@649af4c6 --->com.cenqua.fisheye.web.jetty.FisheyeWebApplicationsContext@....
{noformat}

Is to shutdown your server, edit your {{FISHEYE_INST/config.xml}} and change 

{noformat}
<web-server context="/ognl.OgnalContext...">
        <http bind=":6060"/>
    </web-server>
{noformat}

to:

{noformat}
<web-server>
        <http bind=":6060"/>
    </web-server>
{noformat}

This problem occurs if you have a null or empty context.
fields.summary: Ognl will set the context to some value such as "ognl.OgnlContext@649af4c6" when you EditServerSettings and the context was originally empty

fields.description: Currently textual files include a line count but when browsing binary files there is no indication of their size. I'd like to see their size in bytes/megabytes in place of their line count to get an idea of their size change over time and to be forewarned before choosing to download large "raw" files.
fields.summary: Show file size in bytes for binary files

fields.description:
While testing a demo of Fisheye, I find that it's handling of branches and copies in perforce is a bit weaker than expected.

Because Perforce tracks a file relationships, a branch of a file can be created simply by running the
{noformat}
p4 integrate fromFile toFile
{noformat}
command.

This means branches occur and are tracked on per-file basis in Perforce. 

It would be  a major improvement in Fisheye if it also resolved branches on a per-file basis.

The changeset information you include in Fisheye clearly lists files that have branched, yet you do not resolve the branch history properly. For example in the attached screenshot I was surprised not to see a branch from a common ancestor and a sibling for the file being displayed. This file should not just go straight-line to a "head" revision. 

To properly get the true branch relationships of files in perforce the "p4 integrated" and "p4 filelog" commands need to be used. 

As I said, properly resolving and displaying branch relationships in Fisheye would be a MAJOR improvement.

Thanks,

Jeff.

h5. Docs
https://www.perforce.com/perforce/doc.current/manuals/p4guide/chapter.codelines.html
fields.summary: Improve handling of branching in Perforce

fields.description:
Since fisheye 1.5.4 (see [FE-557|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-557]) we have updated the crowd integration jar files (and associated atlassian-core file) to the 1.4.4. crowd integration jar files, which are not compatible with crowd 1.3. 

Causes the below error:

{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError: Found class com.atlassian.crowd.integration.service.soap.client.ClientProperties, but interface was expected
at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.setupProps(CrowdAuth.java:74)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.<init>(CrowdAuth.java:52)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.<init>(CrowdAuth.java:41)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.UserManager.reload(UserManager.java:184)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.UserManager.<init>(UserManager.java:115)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.RootConfig.openDB(RootConfig.java:882)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.RootConfig.start(RootConfig.java:267)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.mainImpl(Run.java:151)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.main(Run.java:44)
{noformat}

Users should be made aware that if they are to upgrade to 1.6.* or even 1.5.4, they need to upgrade their crowd to 1.4.4
fields.summary: Update Fisheye/crucible release notes to indicate that users with crowd 1.3.* need to upgrade their crowd to 1.4.4

fields.description:
In version 1.6 of fisheye, we can setup an LDAP Authentication. This setting accept a Base DN to looking for people.
We also can add group restriction on repository config "LDAP restriction".
But after some investigation, it seems group restriction with "any" parameters search for groups into same base DN as users.
It is a probleme for our integration (Lotus notes directory) because groups are not define in the same "branch" as users.

For example we have
\
\o=mycompany
\o=mycompany\cn=user1
...

\cn=groupName1
...

Could you add an option to set the base DN for group search. 
Please can you accept empty value to make a search on the whole directory (and not as user setting where you can not enter empty value).

Thx
Christophe
fields.summary: Bad ldap prefix for LDAP restriction into repository permission

fields.description:
The new "Added lines" and "Removed lines" options in the simple search page don't work. Whatever you look for, they don't return any result.
Actually, if you fill in the "Added lines" text box, hit "Search" then switch to "Advanced Search", Fisheye displays the following error message:

{panel}
 Search error:

error parsing query: unexpected token: addedText
{panel}

Indeed, the addedText and removedText keywords are not mentioned in the EQL documentation.
fields.summary: Search for added or removed lines doesn't work

fields.description: I see out of memory exceptions in my log file, but cannot tell which file(s) caused the exception.  I included several extensions for exclusion, but it kept bombing out.  Would like as much information you could give available in the log file when this happens (I ended up having to exclude the entire tag directory for one of the projects for it to finally work).
fields.summary: When throwing an "Out of Memory" exception during processing, display the name of the file that caused the exception

fields.description: It would be nice if I could setup FishEye to not process files that are bigger than a certain size instead of by extension or location.
fields.summary: Add ability to exclude files from being processed by their size

fields.description:
The Fisheye admin console does not let you create a username with spaces.

However, we have security configured to use LDAP Authentication. In our company, the users NT login is "Firstname Lastname". If I select "Create a FishEye user on successful LDAP login", this works fine, creates the username as "Firstname Lastname"

There is a problem, however. In my case, I would like to have the option "Users must be added to FishEye manually", because I dont want all users to have an account to Fisheye. So I go to the "Add user" screen, and type in my desired username "Firstname Lastname", and select "ldap" for the Auth-type, but it wont let me create that user because of spaces.

So in essence,  have LDAP enabled and use this option "Users must be added to FishEye manually" if my usernames have a space in them. Our LDAP directory has over 7,000 employees, so this would be an important fix for us.
fields.summary: Enable Spaces in Username

fields.description: Implement IM notifications for FE.
fields.summary: implement IM notifications

fields.description: need to index CVS diff contents so that they can be searched
fields.summary: implement CVS diff search

fields.description: it's ridiculous that a user is forced to write a regex-linker for JIRA integration to work. Lets build in a JIRA linker type that makes it easier for users to turn on the integration.
fields.summary: FishEye should ship out-of-the-box JIRA linkers

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 
{noformat}
p4 duplicate //TestGround/testarea/test/... //depot/Product/test/... (link to new location)
p4 snap //depot/Product/test/... (copy real archive file to new location)
p4 obliterate //TestGround/testarea/test/... (remove old from view) 
{noformat}

Fisheye will pick up the copy of the files to the new location but the files in the old location will still remain there.
fields.summary: Files still appear in fisheye after a p4 Obliterate

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 

1) Navigate to [https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/test/testfiles/simple] or to some directory within your repository 
2) In the Tarball box, click on zip and download the zip
3) Double click on zip file and you will get the error "Cannot open file: it does not appear to be a valid archive"

If you unzip the file using [7zip|http://www.7-zip.org/]  and then unzip it again you will have the correct contents, so it appears that ie is zipping the file twice.
fields.summary: "Cannot open file: it does not appear to be a valid archive" error thrown for tarball downloads made in IE

fields.description: Currently only files which have *.log* and the config.xml files are included in the support zip that is sent to sac. This should also include the fisheye.out
fields.summary: Include fisheye.out as part of the files that are sent via Raise Support Request in Administration > SysInfo/Support

fields.description: It would be nice to see Bazaar support in FishEye, particularly because there's no planned support for Bazaar directly in JIRA.
fields.summary: Add support BZR / Bazaar scm

fields.description:
eg http://svn.atlassian.com/fisheye/browse/public/contrib/clover/maven1-clover-plugin/trunk/clover-core/project.xml?r=19422
vs the raw version

probably because FE thinks there are 30 lines and won't print more than that in the annotation even if the underlying file has more

looks like it has miscounted the inital lines: http://svn.atlassian.com/fisheye/browse/public/contrib/clover/maven1-clover-plugin/trunk/clover-core/project.xml?r=18168

Firstly, we should fix the display of that page so that it prints out every line in the file, even if the annotation doesn't match up.

Secondly, fix the bug that causes the incorrect annotation
fields.summary: Not all lines of a file shown in file (annotation wrong)

fields.description: If there is only one quicksearch result and it is a file or a directory, we should jump straight to that result.
fields.summary: quicksearch jump to exact file match

fields.description:
We use Jam as our build tool and so almost every directory in our tree contains a 'Jamfile'

If we wanted to quickly get to these files we used the quick search facility, passing part of the path of the Jamfile - e.g. 'cl+\+/Jamfile' - which would return a link to the Jamfile in the cl+\+ directory.  This useful feature no longer works on Fisheye 1.6.1

All we can do now is search for Jamfile, which returns almost 100 pages of (well spaced) results which we can only scroll forward through 1 page at a time (unless we edit the URL which is not ideal for some of our users)
fields.summary: Some of the seach functionality we utilised in Fisheye no longer works in version 1.6.1

fields.description:
Based on provided partial file path (or full url to file in repository - but this repository could be visible as different location than defined in Fisheye) provide full url to this file in Fisheye.

Example:
partial name:  src/test/java/com/atlassian/theplugin/TestConnectionThreadTest.java
or even better (will work with branches and tags)
full repo url (as defined in IDEA): https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/PL/trunk/ThePlugin/idea/src/test/java/com/atlassian/theplugin/TestConnectionThreadTest.java

should produce (studiuo example, real Fisheye differs):
https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/PL/trunk/ThePlugin/idea/src/test/java/com/atlassian/theplugin/TestConnectionThreadTest.java

There is no simple mapping between those urls.
fields.summary: Provide Fisheye url for given file - remote API

fields.description:
I stopped a repository, and then clicked "View".

The page breaks with:

{noformat}
FishEye was unable to process your request.
org.apache.jasper.JasperException

/WEB-INF/jsp/admin/viewrepository.jsp(37,20) PWC6139: Unable to find setter method for attribute: hideText

You are running release CR1.5.5 FE1.5.5 (build-311 2008-08-06), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

Got a problem or a suggestion? Discuss it in the online forums see the website for other support options.
Crucible
FishEye Repositories
{noformat}

In the logs there is a JSP compilation error:

{noformat}
ERROR - Could not execute action
org.apache.jasper.JasperException: /WEB-INF/jsp/admin/viewrepository.jsp(37,20) PWC6139: Unable to find setter method for attribute: hideText
      at org.apache.jasper.compiler.DefaultErrorHandler.jspError(DefaultErrorHandler.java:62)
      at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ErrorDispatcher.dispatch(ErrorDispatcher.java:357)
      at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ErrorDispatcher.jspError(ErrorDispatcher.java:185)
      at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Generator$GenerateVisitor.evaluateAttribute(Generator.java:2885)
      ....
{noformat}
fields.summary: Cannot view a stopped repository

a) blame revision not in the revision dropdown
b) author shown as "other"

See screenshot and https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/src/java/com/atlassian/crucible/spi/data/ReviewItems.java?r=17898

Misc quicksearch improvements

fields.description:
The current documentation doesn't provide instructions for connecting to a repository under HTTP/SSL, but this should be added. It requires using an external webserver, e.g. apache as HTTPS isn't directly supported. Existing related content is:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Integrating+with+Other+Web+Servers
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/1.6+Subversion
fields.summary: Document connecting to repository protected by HTTPS / SSL

fields.description:
In fisheye changesets have an author which is usually some obscure username such as pkamal. If we could associate that author with a FE user, we could pull out the full name, such as Partha Kamal. 

This would be useful for notifications as well
fields.summary: Allow SCM's authors to be associated to a user so that author full name etc can be used

fields.description: I think people will expect quotes to be respected. At the very least we should AND quoted terms.
fields.summary: Quick search: respect quotes

fields.description:
why not make this a lot more verbose, and add prose such as:

"evzijst's LOC increased by 1433 on 2008-09-22 from 380 (2008-8-30) to 1813 (2008-8-30)"
fields.summary: FE: improve tooltip wording.. What does this mean?

fields.description: The author percentages in the source file annotations chart are not consistent with the slices in the pie.
fields.summary: File Annotations legend inconsistent with chart
An initial import of a subversion repository will generate a NPE in some circumstances

fields.description: I would like finer control over what Fisheye puts into repository.  In Perforce terms, this is usually done via a client specification (instead of just a simple path).  For instance, I have a repository path that has numerous sub directories, however, a few of the sub directories have different security requirements.  I would like do define a single Fisheye repository that selects all the sub-directories that are unrestricted and another one for the security restricted sub directories
fields.summary: Allow Perforce respository definition via a client spec

fields.description:
Hi,

we have just updated to the new version of FishEye 1.6, so FishEye has to reindex the repositories. There was no problem, except one repository.This repository has a size of 100MB. 

First we tried with the normal configuration of the JVM, but this leads us in an OutOfMemoryError after 70 min. Than we gave the JVM more memory to excecute (512 MKB - 1 GB). The result of this was that the reindex was finished after 40 min. 

This is quiet long. So, how can we  improve the performance of FishEye for the next update?

Regards
fields.summary: Performance Problems while reindex repositories after update
